intro: Draba cheiranthifolia, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Draba cheiranthifolia is a short-lived perennial, with a flowering period that occurs in late spring to early summer.
